feed.title: Colombo Chetty Genealogy
feed.subtitle: This website contains genealogical research of the Colombo Chetty people conducted by Ben Anandappa.

entry.title: Photo of the Week #4: Casie Chetty - Fernandopulle Wedding

link.title: Photo of the Week #4: Casie Chetty - Fernandopulle Wedding

entry.content:
I hope you’re excited for this Photo of the Week!

If you missed previous posts, you can view them below:

  • Wedding of Anna Anandappa and Ben Anandappa
  • 25th Wedding Anniversary of Ubaldus Adaman and Bridget Rodrigo Sathianathan
  • Wedding of Benson Anandappa and Rajie Casie Chetty

It’s time to check out this week’s photo…

Wedding of Joy Casie Chetty and Poomani Fernandopulle

Thanks to Nirmalie Mirando for providing this photo of the wedding of her parents!

Who's Who? (Left to Right)

  • 👩🏾 Amy Fernandopulle. She is Poomani’s younger sister;
  • 👨🏾 Mervyn Casie Chetty. He is Joy’s younger brother. Mervyn married Julie Alles, daughter of Emmanuel Caetan Alles;
  • 👧🏾 Flavia Casie Chetty. She is the daughter of Joy’s sister Beda and her husband Linus Casie Chetty;
  • 🤵🏾 Joy Casie Chetty. He is the son of Abraham Peter Casie Chetty and Mary Clara Anandappa. His full name is Emmanuel Joseph Gasper, and he likely got his name Gasper from his paternal grandfather and Emmanuel from his maternal grandfather;
  • 👰🏾 Poomani Fernandopulle. She is the daughter of Anthony Joseph Fernandopulle and Mary Chitty. Her full name is Daisy Margaret Poomani;
  • 👦🏾 Joseph. He is the son of Poomani’s sister Othelia;
  • 👨🏾 Zernie Serpachy. He is the best man and friend of the groom;
  • 👩🏾 Rajie Casie Chetty. She is Joy’s sister.
    • Fun fact: Rajie’s wedding was featured in the first Photo of the Week

Feel free to leave a comment below - share your thoughts on the photo or memories of the couple!

Related Content

Explore a few historical documents of their ancestors:

  • 💍 Marriage of Joy’s parents, Mary Clara Anandappa and Abraham Peter Casie Chetty
  • 🪦 Testamentary of Joy’s father, Abraham Peter Casie Chetty
  • 🪦 Testamentary of Joy’s paternal grandmother, Maria Theresa (maiden name unknown)
  • 🪦 Testamentary of Joy’s maternal grandmother, Maria Nathalia Canjemenaden
  • 🪦 Testamentary of Joy’s maternal grandfather, Emmanuel Anandappa
  • 🪦 Testamentary of Poomani’s father, Anthony Joseph Fernandopulle

Here are some relevant family trees for Joy and Poomani:

  • 🌳 Family Tree of Casper Casie Chetty
  • 🌳 Family Tree of Anthony Anandappa
  • 🌳 Family Tree of Anthony Joseph Fernandopulle - recently added!

Research Questions - Can you help?

  • Do you have any photos of Joy Casie Chetty, particularly with his siblings?
  • Do you have any photos of Poomani Fernandopulle, particularly with her siblings?
  • Who are the siblings of Poomani's father Anthony Joseph Fernandopulle?
  • Who are the siblings of Joy's grandfather Casper Casie Chetty?
  • What is the maidan name of Joy's paternal grandmother (i.e. A.P. Casie Chetty's mother)?

Tree updates

A few new trees have been added…

  • 🌳 Family Tree of Anthony Joseph Fernandopulle: this is the family tree of the father of Poomani (from today’s post!)
  • 🌳 Family Tree of Gabriel Ayam Perumal
  • 🌳 Family Tree of Michael Caderamanpulle
  • 🌳 Family Tree of Caitan Fernandopulle
  • 🌳 Family Tree of Xavier Rodrigo Muniarem

There were also a few updates to existing trees:

  • Descendants of Sabina Rodrigo Muttupulle and Henry Theobold Mutukisna have been added - they can be seen in the family trees of Michael Rodrigo Muttupulle and Philip James Mutukisna
  • Children of Maria Theresa Casie Chetty and Charles Nhavel Fernandopulle - they can be seen in the family trees of Casper Casie Chetty and Caitan Nahvel Fernandopulle

Feature update: The family trees have been adjusted to show whether a person had more than one spouse. For example, in the family tree of Philip James Mutukisna, we can now see that Henry Theobold Mutukisna married Juliana Casie Chetty and Sabina Rodrigo Muttupulle.

Contributions

If you have any memories to share, know someone who might, or have relevant primary source material, definitely reach out to me at ben@colombochetty.com or comment below!

For more ideas of ways to contribute, check out the new contributions page.

I hope you're enjoying the website 😄 Please continue to spread the word about Colombo Chetty Genealogy and help others connect with their heritage. Feel free to leave a comment below and click a share button!

– Ben Anandappa

entry.title: Photo of the Week #3: An Anandappa Wedding

link.title: Photo of the Week #3: An Anandappa Wedding

entry.content:
Welcome back to our Photo of the Week - the third in the series.

If you missed previous posts, check them out below:

  • 25th Wedding Anniversary of Ubaldus Adaman and Bridget Rodrigo Sathianathan
  • Wedding of Benson Anandappa and Rajie Casie Chetty

It’s time to dive into this week’s photo…

Wedding of Ben Anandappa and Anna Anandappa

Firstly, the post author Ben Anandappa would like to point out that the Ben Anandappa above is not him 😂 We are related though… he is my great-grandmother’s brother!

Thanks to Genevieve Rodrigopulle for providing this photo of the wedding of her parents!

Ben and Anna married on June 14th, 1944. Let’s look into who were in their wedding party.

Who's Who? (Left to Right)

  • 👩🏾 Poomanie Rodrigo Muniarem Perumal. She is Ben’s niece - the daughter of Ben’s sister Rose Angelina Anandappa and her husband Emmanuel Stephen Rodrigo Muniarem Perumal. Poomanie married Casper Lazarus Joseph Casie Chetty;
  • 👦🏾 Neil Anandappa. He is Anna’s first cousin as his father Joe Anandappa is Anna’s mother’s brother. Neil’s mother was Joyce Perumal, and Neil married Eileen Casie Chetty;
    • Fun fact: Eileen’s brother Neville married Yvonne Adaman who was featured in last week’s post
  • 👰🏾 Anna Anandappa. She is the daughter of Mary Louise Anandappa and Philip Raphael Anandappa, and Anna’s full name was Mary Anna Philomena. She possibly got her name from her maternal grandmother Anna Tavarayan;
    • Fun fact: Anna is Benson’s sister - Benson’s wedding was featured in the first Photo of the Week
  • 🤵🏾 Ben Anandappa. He is the son of Emmanuel Anandappa and Mary Nathalia Canjemenaden, and his full name was Lawrence Benedict Roche;
  • 👨🏾 Prosper Rodrigo Muniarem Perumal. He is Ben’s first cousin as his mother Maria Johanna Anandappa is Ben’s father’s sister. Prosper’s father was J.C. Rodrigo Muniarem Perumal, and Prosper married Helen Juliana Fernandopulle;
  • 👧🏾 Marie Anandappa She is Neil’s brother and she married Joseph Candappa;
  • 👧🏾 Doreen Rodrigo Muniarem Perumal She is Anna’s first cousin as her mother Josephine is Anna’s mother’s sister. Doreen’s father was Anthony Dominic Rodrigo Muniarem Perumal, and Doreen married Philip Cajetan Anthony Anandappa.
    • Fun fact: Doreen is also Prosper Perumal’s niece as Prosper and Anthony Dominic were brothers.

Share your thoughts on the photo and relationships below!

Research Questions - Can you help?

  • Who are the parents of Ben's mother Maria Nathalia Canjemenaden?
  • Who are the siblings of Ben's mother Maria Nathalia Canjemenaden?
  • Who are the parents of Ben's grandfather Anthony Anandappa?
  • Who are the siblings of Ben's grandfather Anthony Anandappa?
  • Who are the parents of Ben's grandmother Anthonia Wijeratnam?
  • Who are the siblings of Ben's grandmother Anthonia Wijeratnam?

Related Content

Here are some relevant family trees for Ben and Anna:

  • 🌳 Family Tree of Anthony Anandappa
  • 🌳 Family Tree of Saviel Pieris Tavarayan
  • 🌳 Family Tree of Peter Benedict Anandappa

Explore a few historical documents of their ancestors:

  • 🪦 Testamentary of Ben’s mother, Maria Nathalia Canjemenaden
  • 🪦 Testamentary of Ben’s father, Emmanuel Anandappa
  • 🪦 Testamentary of Anna’s paternal grandfather, Peter Benedict Anandappa
  • 🪦 Testamentary of Anna’s great-grandfather, Saviel Pieris Tavarayan
  • 💍 Marriage of Anna’s parents, Mary Louise Anandappa and Philip Raphael Anandappa

Contributions

Do you have family photos, wedding photos, portraits or other images of ancestors? We would love to include them, and the website would greatly benefit from your contributions. Please send them to ben@colombochetty.com.

In addition, if you have any memories to share, know someone who might, or have relevant primary source material, definitely reach out or comment below!

I hope you're enjoying the website 😄 Please continue to spread the word about Colombo Chetty Genealogy and help others connect with their heritage. Feel free to leave a comment below and click a share button!

– Ben Anandappa

entry.title: Photo of the Week #2: The Adaman Family

link.title: Photo of the Week #2: The Adaman Family

entry.content:
Welcome back to the second installment of Colombo Chetty Genealogy’s Photo of the Week!

If you missed last week’s post of Benson Anandappa and Rajie Casie Chetty’s wedding, be sure to check it out here.

Let’s dive in to this week’s photo…

25th Wedding Anniversary of Ubaldus Adaman and Bridget Rodrigo Sathianathan

I’m so excited to share this beautiful photo with you all. I must thank Carmel Adaman for providing it, as well as Delano Caderamanpulle for introducing me to your Aunty Carmel. I meant it when I said that I was awestruck when I first saw this photo!

Who's Who? (Left to Right)

Standing

  • 👨🏾 Canute Solomon Adaman. He would go on to marry Olu de Alwis;
  • 👩🏾 Mary Iphegenia Adaman. She married Didacus Caderamanpulle, who is the son of Michael Caderamanpulle and Regina Laity Ramanaden;
  • 👩🏾 Yvonne Adaman. Her husband is Neville Casie Chetty, who is son of Mary Cecelia Anandappa and Caspar Joseph Casie Chetty (Fun Fact: Caspar Joseph is Rajie Casie Chetty’s first cousin);
  • 👩🏾 Cheryl Bridget Adaman. She married Joseph Sinniah.

Sitting

  • 👩🏾 Praxede Venetia Adaman;
  • 👨🏾 Ubaldus Stanislaus Adaman. Also known by his initials U.S.A. His parents aren’t known at this time;
  • 👩🏾 Carmel Adaman. The very person who provided this family photo!
  • 👩🏾 Mary Bridget Rodrigo Sathianathan. She is the daughter of Caitan Dominic Rodrigo Sathianathan and Theresa Laity Ramanaden;
  • 👩🏾 Callista Adaman. Her husband is Chelva Rajaratnam.

What do you think of the photo? Share your comments below!

Related Content

Here are some relevant family trees and documents for Ubaldus and Bridget:

  • 🌳 Family Tree of Caitan Dominic Rodrigo Sathianathan
  • 🌳 Family Tree of Paul Laity Ramanaden
  • 🌳 Family Tree of Ubaldus Stanislaus Adaman
  • 💍 Marriage of Bridget’s parents, Caitan Dominic Rodrigo Sathianathan and Theresa Laity Ramanaden

Research Questions - Can you help?

  • Who are the parents of Ubaldus Stanislaus Adaman?
  • Who are the siblings Ubaldus Stanislaus Adaman?
  • What are the full names of the siblings of Bridget Rodrigo Sathianathan?
  • Who are the siblings of Bridget’s father Caitan Rodrigo Sathianathan?
  • Who are the siblings of Bridget's mother Theresa Laity Ramanaden?

If you have any memory of these people, know someone who might, or have relevant primary source material, definitely reach out or comment below!

What about secondary sources? In order to keep the website as accurate as possible, I kindly request that that you refrain from providing information from secondary sources (such as Worldgenweb). Thanks for understanding!

Site Updates

A few important site updates…

  • 🎉 We welcomed 10 new members this week!
  • 🌳 Thanks to members Ephrem Mutukisna and Michael Fernandopulle for helping to form more connections on the family trees. These additions will be made in the coming week.
  • 🖼️ Thanks to member Nirmalie Mirando for sending a wedding photo of her parents Joy Casie Chetty and Poomani Fernandopulle. Be on the look out for this photo in a future Photo of the Week!

Do you have family photos, wedding photos, portraits or other images of ancestors? We would love to include them, and the website would greatly benefit from your contributions. Please send them to ben@colombochetty.com.

I hope you're enjoying the website 😄 Please continue to spread the word about Colombo Chetty Genealogy and help others connect with their heritage. Feel free to leave a comment below and click a share button!

– Ben Anandappa

entry.title: Photo of the Week #1: Anandappa - Casie Chetty Wedding

link.title: Photo of the Week #1: Anandappa - Casie Chetty Wedding

entry.content:
Each week, I plan to post a photo of Colombo Chetty ancestors and discuss the relationships that exist between those in the photo. For the very first post, I’ll start with the wedding of my grandparents…

Benson Anandappa and Rajie Casie Chetty's Wedding

You may recognize this from the banner on the front page of colombochetty.com! Thank you to Genevieve Rodrigopulle for providing this photo and for helping to identify everyone. I was so excited when I first saw this photo in February 2023 as it was the first time I saw my grandfather 🤯

Without further ado, let’s get into the “who’s who” of the photo:

Back Row

  • 👩🏾 Annette Anandappa is the daughter of Enid Anandappa & Theodore “Tiddy” Anandappa, and she is Rajie’s first cousin;
  • 👨🏾 Tony Anandappa is Benson’s brother;
  • 👨🏾 Pius Anandappa is the son of Joseph Caitan Anandappa & Magdalene Tavarayan, and he is the first cousin of both Rajie’s mother and Benson’s mother;
  • 👩🏾 Hyacinth Casie Chetty is Rajie’s sister, and she later married Pius!

Front Row

  • 👧🏾 Mano Casie Chetty is a daughter of Rajie’s brother Joy;
  • 👧🏾 Carmel Anandappa is a daughter of Rajie’s sister Queenie;
  • 👦🏾 Frank Anandappa is Carmel’s brother;
  • 👧🏾 Romany Anandappa is a daughter of Benson’s sister Anna;
  • 👦🏾 Elmo Casie Chetty is a son of Rajie’s sister Beda.

That’s all for the wedding party. Let’s talk more about the bride and groom themselves…

The Couple

  • 👰🏾 Rajie’s parents were Mary Clara Anandappa and Abraham Peter Casie Chetty. Rajie was her nickname - her full name was Annabelle Mary Nathalia Rasappopathy. It appears that she got one of her middle names, Nathalia, from Mary Clara’s mother Nathalia Canjemenaden;
  • 🤵🏾 Benson was the son of Mary Louise Anandappa and Philip Raphael Anandappa. His full name, Anthony Xavier Benedict, is likely a combination of both of his grandfathers - Mary Louise’s father Anthony Xavier and Philip Raphael’s father Peter Benedict.

Benson and Rajie would go on to have four children together: Charmaine, Oswin, Fiona and Romello (my dad!).

Did you know Benson, Rajie, or anyone from their wedding party? Please share your memories in the comments.

Related Content

Here are some relevant family trees for Rajie and Benson:

  • 🌳 Family Tree of Casper Casie Chetty
  • 🌳 Family Tree of Anthony Anandappa
  • 🌳 Family Tree of Saviel Pieris Tavarayan
  • 🌳 Family Tree of Peter Benedict Anandappa

Explore a few historical documents of their ancestors:

  • 💍 Marriage of Rajie’s parents, Mary Clara Anandappa and Abraham Peter Casie Chetty
  • 💍 Marriage of Benson’s parents, Mary Louise Anandappa and Philip Raphael Anandappa
  • 🪦 Testamentary of Rajie’s father, Abraham Peter Casie Chetty
  • 🪦 Testamentary of Rajie’s paternal grandmother, Maria Theresa (maiden name unknown)
  • 🪦 Testamentary of Rajie’s maternal grandmother, Maria Nathalia Canjemenaden
  • 🪦 Testamentary of Rajie’s maternal grandfather, Emmanuel Anandappa
  • 🪦 Testamentary of Benson’s paternal grandfather, Peter Benedict Anandappa
  • 🪦 Testamentary of Benson’s great-grandfather, Saviel Pieris Tavarayan

Site updates

A few important site updates…

  • 🎉 We have reached over 50 members since launch!
  • 🌐 Some members reached out to provide additional people to the trees and these are reflected in the website. We’re now almost at 1,300 people in the database!
  • ✏ A few misspellings were brought to my attention and these have been updated.
  • 🗑 The “Photo” tab has been removed as photos will appear in blog posts (like this one) instead.
  • 🔍 There is now a tab for “People” to make the page easier to find. This page is a good starting point to find profiles and their corresponding trees.

Further corrections and additions are more than welcome, and these contributions are invaluable towards the mission of creating an accurate, well-documented genealogy of the Colombo Chetty Community!

If you have any primary source material (e.g. marriage certificates, birth records, obituaries, newspapers, memorial cards, obituaries, photos), the website would greatly benefit from including these. I would be happy to hear from you at ben@colombochetty.com.

If you're enjoying the website, I hope you continue to spread the word about Colombo Chetty Genealogy and help others connect with their ancestry. Click one of the share buttons below!

– Ben Anandappa

entry.title: Launch Day!
entry.content:
Today - June 16 2023 - is the official launch of colombochetty.com 🎉

With over 200 historical documents and 1200+ people in our database, colombochetty.com aims to preserve the genealogy of the Colombo Chetty people.

Check out this video overvew of the site here📍

I hope you enjoy exploring historical documents and family trees, as well as the homepage which has a profile of Anthony Xavier Anandappa whose 150th birth anniversary is this year. To get full access to all content and stay up to date, please sign up (or login). For more background on the project, checkout this about page.

A quick aside… June 16 also happens to be the birthday of my grandfather, Benson Anandappa, as well as his brothers Tony and Regis - they were coincidentally born on the same day in different years! I would like to dedicate this website to these three brothers.

Thank you to everyone who has taken the time to talk with me and share your memories. I’ve had a lot of fun working on this project and I’m so happy to now share it with all of you through this website.

This website is a work-in-progress and I plan to continually add content and create posts. Here are a few features that I would love to add in the future:

  • 🗓 Calendar of birth, death and marriage dates of ancestors (and the living!)
  • 🗺 Map of the current location of Colombo Chetties
  • 🏘 A recreation of New Chetty Street from the early 1900s
  • 👴 More detailed stories of ancestors

Please feel free to reach out to me at ben@colombochetty.com. If you notice anyone missing from the family trees, I will be happy to add them. Any contributions such as historical documents or stories are more than welcome, too, and I would love to hear what you think of the website!

– Ben Anandappa
